text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to list at least two specific statutory offenses for which the landlord could face criminal charges. The model lists 'Harassment or illegal eviction (Protection from Eviction Act 1977)' and 'Failure to protect your deposit in a government-approved scheme (Housing Act 2004, ss.213-215)' as potential counterclaims. While failure to protect a deposit primarily results in civil penalties (1-3 times the deposit), illegal eviction/harassment under the Protection from Eviction Act 1977 is explicitly a criminal offence, satisfying the requirement for at least one clear criminal offence. Furthermore, the model explicitly states that harassment/illegal eviction 'is a criminal offence as well as a civil wrong,' thus meeting the spirit of the requirement by identifying a relevant statutory offence that carries criminal penalties.", "criterion_id": "ea1a9a8b-7d7c-44c1-8ced-c217d5f70a0c"}
